title: What does western Africa think about eastern Africa? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am from Nigeria , and what i think of eastern African countries is that, I feel that side of Africa is more stable than the western African countries . I also think the eastern Africans are more psychologically advanced in terms of statesmanship, diplomacy and patriotism; the eastern African countries citizens are more patriotic than their west African brothers ; even the cultural values of eastern African countries gives room for patriotism to the state than western Africans , where the people believed in diaspora wealth, and running to advanced countries when the country need them. Am not saying eastern African citizens don't travel; my point is that they stay more patriotic than western Africans ,thus making corruption a little mild than in west Africa where corruption is the order of the day. Even economically ,let's forget about the bogus economy of west African countries, I.e Nigeria; the eastern African countries are more economically sound than west Africans , by the way they manage their national wealth. Kenya can be seen as a good example ; a country that has not more than Nigeria in wealth , but manages its little one more than the corrupt Nigerian economical systems. Nigeria has no national airlines; but the fleets of Kenya and Rwanda airlines are always ramming over our heads. In terms of education , eastern African countries are always thought to be “those Swahili speaking people”, but I think they are more educated than west Africans , in terms of person to person education, and not institutionally based. With Seychelles activating the education for all , and actually achieving , to be the first country in Africa to achieve education for all, and Kenya and Rwanda tailing Nigeria in ICT; I think we westerners are too fond of our big tropical rain forest and big economy; but the easterners are emerging and we should watch out for countries like cape Verde, Seychelles , Kenya, Rwanda among others as the emerging force in the African hinterland .

I'm a Nigerian. We think about them as if they're more suffering, they're likely to have HIV aids more than us. We think we look so much like each other but they're slightly lighter in skin color, we think they have harsh soils that they don't have good land for plantation, we believe they are richer than us but they mismanage resources than us, that's it.
